info.title: Best Execution Search Results
info.description:
This API product supports scaled and streamlined product 
            and pricing data to make it easier to display results directly to consumers.

post.description:
An initiating call to the API, specifying a scenario for qualification purposes. The response will return the single best execution product at each rate 
            available to streamline results for direct to consumer applications. A flag can be sent for Optimal Blue to calculate the total loan amount for government 
            transactions, in which case the total loan upfront mortgage insurance premiums will be considered as fully financed. If any portion needs to be paid in 
            cash, or conventional borrower paid upfront MI is required please submit the entire Total Loan Amount container with the calculateTotalLoanAmount 
            field as \"false\". Please note that the fields within the \"expandedGuidelines\" container will only be evaluated for those products that are tied to the 
            \"productTypes\" of \"nonQM\". The product guidelines in the response are optional, and can be excluded from the response if you append ? 
            $deselect=Products/Guidelines to the end of the request.

get.description:
Once the eligible products are returned from the Best Execution Only request, an additional call can be made to receive all detailed pricing information 
            for a product. This will be derived from the search ID and product ID provided. The response will return all price, rate, lock period combinations 
            for the requested product. Additionally, all adjustments, ratio calculations, notes and advisories will be returned.

post.description:
This endpoint will return the full payment stream for the Product provided in the route, including information for each month's payment, 
            monthly/annual mortgage insurance (if applicable) and any rate changes. For Adjustable Rate Mortgages those rate changes and associated payment 
            changes will be based on the fully indexed rate. This endpoint will also return the APR and the values used to determine the APR.
